taskDescription: Read the following statements and identify what needs each statement applies to.

textField:
Make premises accessible using ramps etc. - *physical difficulties that lead to mobility impairments*
Provide parking that is clearly set aside for those with mobility difficulties - *physical difficulties that lead to mobility impairments*
Offer your elbow if guiding a person with sight loss. Do not take their arm  - *sensory impairment such as sight loss* 
Speak directly to the customer, not to a third party - *sensory impairment such as sight loss*
Do not startle the customer when approaching them – *gently touch their arm - Hearing Loss*
Face the customer and always keep your face fully visible so that they can lip-read without any obstruction - *Hearing Loss*
Be patient and listen carefully - *speech difficulties *
If you have not understood what the customer has said, tell them and ask them to repeat what they have said - *speech difficulties*
Ask simple questions - *English isn’t their first language*
Avoid colloquial expressions - *English isn’t their first language*
Do not rush elderly customers – be patient - *elderly customers*
Offer assistance with heavy items, carry bags to car - *elderly customers*
Do not patronise the customer or raise your voice - *customers with learning difficulties*
Repeat yourself, explaining using different words and phrases, if necessary - *customers with learning difficulties*
